intro: Tithymalus myrsinites, commonly known as the rock rose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a shrub characterized by its woody stems and dense clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or coastal areas. Its leaves are typically narrow and gray-green, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Tithymalus myrsinites is valued in gardens for its ornamental appeal and resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
